titleStmt.title: [Letter] 1838 Sep. 15, Elyton, Alabama [to] Henry King, Tuskaloosa, Alabama / J. Woods : a machine readable transcription of an image
titleStmt.author: Woods, J.

It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact The Albert Gore Research Center, P.O. Box 193, Middle Tennessee State University, Murfreesboro, TN 37132.

bibl.title: [Letter] 1838 Sep. 15, Elyton, Alabama [to] Henry King, Tuskaloosa, Alabama / J. Woods
bibl.author: Woods, J.
bibl.note: This is a short letter dated September 15, 1838 from J. Woods to Henry King. The content of the letter concerns the selling price of meat in different areas of the South, including North Carolina and Alabama.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 3.0 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.p: I think their will be no difficulty in Selling out at 14 or 15 cents thier is no bacon hear it is getting scearce every whare that I hear from Taylor & Jackson passed through hear on yesterday they sold out about Greensborough at ¢15 for shoders sides from 16 to 17 cents and hames at ¢18 3/4 If do not sell out untill Brawley and the rest of the meat men do you can sell Sell for a mutch better price than you are offering to take I dont feel very well this morning though I dont feel like stoping on the way if I can help it; I add no more but hope these few lines may find you in good health and making brisk sales at fair prices give my best respects to W Parrish and family and Col WR King right to Salem & Roads in a few days
div1.closer: your friend Jn Woods Mr H A J King N.B. There is no Bacon coming to supply the meat murchants if any should come they cant buy it to as to sell for a low price JW.
